result.execSummary:
The defendant Deeann C Priem was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid in full by 11-06-2015 or serve 5 days jail as penalty for failure to pay fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

District Attorney Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy by Atty. Flynn in court.   
Defendant Deeann C Priem did not appear.  
Attorney appeared by Authorization previously filed.
Jury Trial Cancelled.

State moves to amend count 2 to a county ordinance of DC 13.102(c)(8).
Defense has no objections.

Atty. Flynn enters a plea of No Contest to the amended charge on behalf of her client.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $267.50
To be paid in full by:  11/06/15.
Alternate:  5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
